unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Rolling Doubles: What are the Chances?
question_text:
When two fair, $6$-sided dice are tossed, the result is called “doubles” if both dice land with the same number of dots showing (for example, both dice land with $3\text{ dots}$ showing).
What is the probability that when tossing two dice, more than $4\text{ tosses}$ will be needed in order to get doubles for the first time?
